snippet: Timothy Ritvo, the chief operating officer of the Stronach Group, which operates Pimlico Race Course, said there was a “real good possibility” that the Preakness would be moved to Sunday next year.
abstract: Preakness Stakes, second leg of the Triple Crown, may move from Saturday to Sunday as early as next year in effort to increase business; officials are also considering moving the race from Pimlico Race Course to refurbished Laurel Park.
lead_paragraph: Timothy Ritvo, the chief operating officer of the Stronach Group, which operates Pimlico Race Course, said there was a “real good possibility” that the Preakness would be moved to Sunday next year.

headline.main: Preakness Could Leave Pimlico and Run on Sunday to Increase Revenue
headline.print_headline: Preakness Could Leave Pimlico and Run on Sunday
